adjective.description: (of a role or status) existing in name only.
examples: Thailand retained nominal independence under Japanese military occupation

adjective.description: (of a price or amount of money) very small; far below the real value or cost.
examples: some firms charge only a nominal fee for the service

adjective.description: (of a quantity or dimension, especially of manufactured articles) stated or expressed but not necessarily corresponding exactly to the real value.
examples: legislation allowed variation around the nominal weight (that printed on each packet)

adjective.description: Relating to, headed by, or having the function of a noun.
(chiefly in the context of space travel) functioning normally or acceptably.

origin: Late 15th century (as a term in grammar): from Latin nominalis, from nomen, nomin- name.
